TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1650-1651
TEI.2.document_title: Tacitus Clay to Stephen F. Austin, 05-31-1827

barker_notes.barker_summary: Tacitus Clay to Austin, May 31, 1827. Land. Scarcity of writing materials.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1650-1651

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p**/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*New Years Creek*/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col - Austin*/person_mentioned* the tract of land which I wish you to reserve for me it being my Chois is on the *location_mentioned*south fork of this creek begining at or near where *person_mentioned*Allcorn */person_mentioned*desires haveing his upper line run thense extending up for quantity so as to include sd branch of the creek*/location_mentioned* it being not a permanent stream without pen ink or paper it is necessary to be laconick*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Tacitus Clay*/person_mentioned**/p* *p**date_mentioned n="05-31-1827">May the 31th—1827*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
